comments: a(500500) mod 500500507 is the solution to Problem 500 on Project Euler. - _Danny Rorabaugh_, Sep 25 2015Positions where the number of infinitary divisors of n (A037445), increases to a record (cf. A002182). - _Vladimir Shevelev_, May 13 2016
links: T. D. Noe and Danny Rorabaugh, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..350 (first 101 terms from T. D. Noe)
formula: A000005(a(n)) = A000079(n).a(n) = prod(k=1, n, A050376(k)), product of the first n entries of A050376(n). - _Lekraj Beedassy_, Jun 30 2004a(n) = A052330(2^n -1). - _Thomas Ordowski_, Jun 29 2005A001221(a(n+1)) <= A001221(a(n))+1, see also A074239; A007947(a(n)) gives a sequence of primorials (A002110) in nondecreasing order. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 16 2006, corrected: Apr 09 2015a(n) = A005179(2^n). - _Ivan N. Ianakiev_, Apr 01 2015
mathematica: a[0] = 1; a[n_] := a[n] = Catch[ For[ k = 2, True, k++, If[ an = k*a[n-1]; DivisorSigma[0, an] == 2^n, Throw[an]]]]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 18}](* _Jean-FranÃ§ois Alcover_, Apr 16 2012 *)
prog: (PARI) {a(n)= local(A,m,c,k,p); if(n<1, n==0, c=0; A=1; m=1; while( c<n, m++; if( isprime(m)| ( (k=ispower(m, (null),&p))&isprime(p)& k ==2^valuation(k,2) ), A*=m; c++)); A)} /* _Michael Somos_, Apr 15 2005 */(Haskell)a037992 n = head [x | x <- [1..], a000005 x == 2 ^ n]-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 08 2015
author: _J. Lowell_
